creator: yak@tmok.com
text:
Under TC 4.0b3, I have two webapps, one in the root context and one in
a context called "test".  Both have incompatible jars called "vcc.jar"
in their respective WEB-INF/lib directories.  I have identically
named filters fetched from vcc.jar configured for ROOT and test.
ROOT is missing a dependency of a class used by its filter, and test's
filter version does not require that class to operate.  When I request
any page in the /test hierarchy, it gives me a NoClassDefFoundError
for the class that is missing in the ROOT context, but should not be
required for test.  Deleting vcc.jar from the ROOT context causes the
correct vcc.jar to be loaded for test and test works fine.

My interpreation is that the class loader is pulling vcc.jar from the
wrong webapp when there are two lying around.

yak
(replies to brad@vecna.com)

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
Your interpretation isn't correct ;-)
You can find additional explanations in the comments of bug #1219.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 1219 ***
